title: 110_hr938
content: The "Nuclear Family Priority Act" changes preference allocation for spouses and children of permanent resident aliens and amends the worldwide level of family-sponsored immigrants. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allocate 75 percent of family-sponsored immigrant visas without regard to per country limitations, with the remaining 25 percent available for countries subject to specific conditions. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to allocate family-sponsored immigrant visas without per country limitations, with a subsection (e) ceiling defined as 77 percent of the maximum number of visas available under section 203(a) for immigrants from specific countries. Subsection (e) is further modified by removing certain paragraphs and redesignating others. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to update rules for determining alien children and procedures for granting immigrant status. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to update rules for determining alien children and procedures for granting immigrant status, including waivers of inadmissibility and conditional permanent resident status for certain alien spouses and family members. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on the first day of the second fiscal year after enactment, with certain exceptions for invalid petitions and visa applications related to eliminated immigrant categories.
